INTR.BA.long_name: Compañía Introductora de Buenos Aires S.A.
INTR.BA.summary: CompaÃ±Ã­a Introductora de Buenos Aires S.A. industrializes and commercializes table salt, flavor seasonings, vinegars, olive oil, ketchup, soy sauce, and syrups for households. It also offers its products for companies that process food, textile companies, petrochemicals, and others. The company was founded in 1901 and is based in Buenos Aires, Argentina. CompaÃ±Ã­a Introductora de Buenos Aires S.A. is a subsidiary of F V Sociedad Anonima.

MOLI.BA.long_name: Molinos Rio de la Plata S.A.
MOLI.BA.summary: Molinos Rio de la Plata S.A. operates in the food sector in Argentina. The company offers noodles, soy schnitzel, rice, breadcrumbs and mixes for gnocchi, pizza, crepes, torta frita cakes, and chipÃ¡ cheese buns; and pasta, cutlets, nuggets, breaded foods and sides, risottos, brownies, gelatins, desserts, ice creams, mousses, light pleasures line, extra virgin olive oil, soy sauce, balsamic vinegar, corn oil, cooking oil, light salad dressings, cooking sprays, coffee, lemon juice, yerba products, self-rising flour, rice biscuits, and nutritional meal products for babies. It sells its products under the Lucchetti, Matarazzo, Granja del Sol, Gallo, Gallo Snacks, Delverde, Don Vicente, Exquisita, Cocinero, Fideos Terrabusi, Don Felipe, Fideos Favorita, canale, Preferido, Vitina, Arlistan, Lira, Minerva, Cruz de Malta, Nobleza Gaucha, and Blancaflor brands. The company also exports its products. Molinos Rio de la Plata S.A. was founded in 1902 and is based in Victoria, Argentina.
